alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 12:51PM MST until January 18 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ TUESDAY TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma County. In Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Tuesday to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be extremely difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute. Road closures may be possible, avoid driving around barricades. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northerly winds gusting up to 30 MPH will be possible. These winds could cause blowing and drifting snow, even after snowfall has ended.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
